1.brief: David, the youngest son of Jesse
properly, instrumental music; by implication, a poem set to notes
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music

2.brief: to be (causatively, make or act) circumspect and hence, intelligent
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth
properly, extent (of time); but used only adverbially (especially with other particle prefixes), when (either relative or interrogative)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)

3.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to place (in a very wide application)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause
without profit, worthlessness; by extension, destruction, wickedness
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
to detrude, i.e. (intransitively and figuratively) become derelict (wrongly practise; namely, idolatry)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to impinge, i.e. cling or adhere; figuratively, to catch by pursuit

4.brief: the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

5.brief: to wag the tongue, i.e. to calumniate
a cover (in a good or a bad, a literal or a figurative sense)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
roomy, in any (or every) direction, literally or figuratively
the heart (as the most interior organ);
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be able, literally (can, could) or morally (may, might)

6.brief: an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)
properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
to walk (in a great variety of applications, literally and figuratively)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
entire (literally, figuratively or morally); also (as noun) integrity, truth

he (she or it); only expressed when emphatic or without a verb; also (intensively) self, or (especially with the article) the same; sometimes (as demonstrative) this or that; occasionally (instead of copula) as or are
to attend as a menial or worshipper; figuratively, to contribute to

7.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry
properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
a house (in the greatest variation of applications, especially family, etc.)
to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue
an untruth; by implication, a sham (often adverbial)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to be erect (i.e. stand perpendicular); hence (causatively) to set up, in a great variety of applications, whether literal (establish, fix, prepare, apply), or figurative (appoint, render sure, proper or prosperous)
a front, i.e. part opposite; specifically a counterpart, or mate; usually (adverbial, especially with preposition) over against or before
an eye (literally or figuratively); by analogy, a fountain (as the eye of the landscape)

8.brief: properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
morally wrong; concretely, an (actively) bad person
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)
a city (a place guarded by waking or a watch) in the widest sense (even of a mere encampment or post)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to do or make (systematically and habitually), especially to practise
